alert.note: Alert for Houston; Perry; Stewart; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 2:58PM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Cannon, Cheatham, Clay, Cumberland, Davidson, De Kalb, Dickson, Fentress, Hickman, Houston, Humphreys, Jackson, Lewis, Macon, Maury, Montgomery, Overton, Perry, Pickett, Putnam, Robertson, Rutherford, Smith, Stewart, Sumner, Trousdale, Wayne, White, Williamson and Wilson. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
